text:
I'm Eric and I'm a cloud architect
working for Thales.

We are working on a biometric core system
responsible for biometric enrolment

and matching processes
that is used in law enforcement programs,

airports, passport scans, facial
recognition, fingerprint scanning.

AWS Skills Guild
has been good for our team because I think

it brings a very organized approach
in the way how we can deliver learning
methods and learning platforms.
For some people itâ€™s a bit difficult

to know where to start
when you want to go into the cloud.

But now, having clearly defined learning
paths that are provided by the Skills

Guild program, really helped them
to get started on that subject.

I really like the holistic approach
that the program has because it gives us

a community of what we call champions
inside the OXYGEN program with whom

we exchange weekly or sometimes biweekly
basis about new subjects going on.

As part of being this champion,
we are responsible to promote

the cloud trainings
inside the organization.

I will promote the usage of OXYGEN
and of the various cloud trainings
that are available to them

in order to increase cloud adoption
and cloud trainings inside the company.

The fact that we give the different
training programs and platforms

to our engineers, we already see that
they can build common synergies
and they can find new ideas.

Because of the Skills Guild training,
we really see that we have more innovation

because of more collaboration
because people clearly know

whom they can talk to
when they face technical challenges
and therefore find solutions faster.
